qas.question: Where does the Arctic tern migrate each year?

answers.text: between Arctic breeding grounds and the Antarctic

qas.question: which bird migrates by circling the earth?

answers.text: between their northern breeding grounds and the southern ocean

qas.question: What is an example of a shorter migration?

answers.text: altitudinal migrations on mountains such as the Andes and Himalayas

context: <a0_0>The Arctic tern<a0_0/> holds the long-distance migration record for birds, travelling <a1_0>between Arctic breeding grounds and the Antarctic<a1_0/> each year. Some species of tubenoses (Procellariiformes) such as <a2_0>albatrosses<a2_0/> circle the earth, flying over the southern oceans, while others such as Manx shearwaters migrate 14,000 km (8,700 mi) <a3_0>between their northern breeding grounds and the southern ocean<a3_0/>. Shorter migrations are common, including <a4_0>altitudinal migrations on mountains such as the Andes and Himalayas<a4_0/>.
